Description: Textile fragment; rectangle of undyed linen cloth with torn edges except for the remains of part of a warp fringe, held at the top by a line of hitches grouping warp threads into 3s, 5s..; traces of a self band at the opposite end. Selvedge at either end. Linen is mainly cream coloured, but with dark, waxy stains. Well worn. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.28 ends per 10mm and weft 14 picks per 10mm.
